JUDGES: Corneliu Bîrsan;David Thór Björgvinsson;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively .
CARDINAL . Mr PERSON , PERSON and Mr PERSON live in GPE , PERSON lives in ORG and Mr PERSON lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The application was lodged together with CARDINAL more applicants , who died during the proceedings : Mr PERSON , who was born in DATE , lived in GPE and died on CARDINAL DATE , and Mr PERSON , who was born in DATE , lived in GPE and died on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicants were represented by Mr PERSON .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , ORG Attorney - General .
CARDINAL . In accordance with LAW , the Registrar informed ORG of their right to submit written comments . In their reply of DATE , ORG did not indicate that they wished to exercise their right .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . The applicants are heirs of Mr PERSON and his wife , PERSON PERSON .

CARDINAL . NORP The PERSON family has lived in what is DATE GPE since DATE . By DATE they had acquired , exclusively by purchase , extensive real estate and numerous companies , as well as movable assets ( such as objects of art , etc ) .

CARDINAL . After the Second World War , GPE became a constituent part of the newly formed NORP Federal GPE . Its former legislative body was ORG for ORG ( “ the LAW ” ) , the highest political body in GPE during and immediately after the Second World War . On DATE it adopted a decree ( “ the ORG decree , ” see under “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” ) which prescribed , inter alia , the nationalisation of all property belonging to ORG and its citizens which was on the territory of GPE , of people of NORP origin , except those who were fighting for the national liberation movement , and finally , of all persons who were criminally convicted by a military or an ordinary court and sentenced to forfeiture of their property ( see “ Relevant Domestic Law and Practice ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted PERSON PERSON and PERSON of the offence of high treason during the Second World War . Mr PERSON was sentenced to DATE and PERSON to DATE deprivation of liberty with forced labour . They were also stripped off of their political and civil rights and ordered to forfeit all their property to the ORG .

CARDINAL . Probably towards DATE , PERSON , PERSON and Mr PERSON ( the first son of PERSON ) lost their lives in a work camp in circumstances that still remain unclear . On DATE ORG ( in GPE ) adopted a decision to the effect that Mr PERSON and PERSON should be deemed no longer to be alive after DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after the independence of GPE and the change of the political regime , the ORG of ORG ( PERSON v Mariboru ) , at the request of Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , decided to reopen the criminal proceedings against Mr PERSON and PERSON . On DATE ORG withdrew the indictment against Mr PERSON and PERSON . Consequently , ORG quashed the convictions and discontinued the criminal proceedings against them . The decision became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON also lodged a request for declaratory decisions concerning the citizenship of Mr PERSON and PERSON with the GPE . On DATE the Municipality adopted CARDINAL decisions certifying that Mr PERSON and PERSON were NORP and NORP citizens until their death .

CARDINAL . On DATE LAW ( Zakon o denacionalizaciji , see “ LAW and Practice ” ) came into force , following which the applicants lodged a request for restitution of the property forfeited by PERSON and PERSON with ORG of the Slovenska Bistrica Municipality 's ORG ( ORG za denacionalizacijo , Skupščina Občine PERSON ) . On DATE the latter informed the applicants that their request was incomplete , informed them about the requirements set forth by LAW and instructed them to amend their request .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the applicants lodged claims for restitution of property under LAW with the GPE , GPE , GPE and FAC GPE , respectively . At an undetermined time , a claim under the same provisions was lodged with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants and a company , PERSON . , reached an out - of - court settlement regarding the restitution of a part of the company 's property which constituted a part of the property the applicants claimed in the proceedings before GPE . The applicants were awarded company shares worth QUANTITY . The settlement was confirmed by GPE on DATE and the proceedings concerning this property were terminated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Act on Temporary , Partial Suspension of Restitution of Property ( Zakon o začasnem , delnem zadržanju vračanja premoženja ) was adopted , which temporarily suspended the restitution of certain types of property , and which affected also the denationalisation proceedings to which the applicants were parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants withdrew all their claims made under LAW , and started restitution proceedings under LAW ( Zakon o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij , see below , and under “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” ) . Consequently , the different sets of denationalisation proceedings to which the applicants were parties were terminated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants also instituted proceedings against GPE in ORG ( Okrožno sodišče v PERSON ) , seeking compensation for the loss of profit they had incurred by being prevented from using the forfeited property . At an undetermined time , the proceedings were stayed until the termination of the proceedings concerning the restitution of the property ( see below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Act on the Temporary Suspension of Certain Provisions of the Denationalisation Act and of LAW ( Zakon o začasnem zadržanju izvajanja nekaterih določb zakona o denacionalizaciji in zakona o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij , see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” ) was adopted . This resulted again in a stay of all the proceedings to which the applicants were parties .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE , after withdrawing their restitution claims under LAW , the applicants lodged requests for restitution of property under the provisions of LAW ( Zakon o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij , see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” ) with CARDINAL ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted uncontentious civil proceedings in the ORG ( ORG sodišče v PERSON ) against CARDINAL legal entities , among them GPE , GPE ( Občina Slovenska Bistrica ) , the Farmland and Forest Fund of GPE ( Sklad kmetijskih zemljišč in gozdov PERSON , “ the Fund ” ) and several museums . They requested restitution of numerous plots of land , buildings , an extensive collection of art paintings , and other property taken from their predecessors , Mr PERSON and PERSON , following ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE . They also requested the court to allow certain interim measures preventing the sale or encumbrance of the property at issue , which was at the time in the possession of the company PERSON .

CARDINAL . After a hearing held on DATE , the court on DATE allowed the interim measure . After CARDINAL subsequent sets of appellate proceedings and new requests for re - examination of the case , ORG ( PERSON ) on DATE confirmed the first - instance court decision on the interim measure as final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants urged the court to decide promptly on the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court delivered a decision inviting the applicants to amend their request of DATE in order to satisfy the requirements under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicants ' request , the court extended the deadline for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged written submissions supplementing their original request .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court issued a decision rejecting the applicants ' request with respect to CARDINAL adversaries since the applicants had failed to amend correctly their request . With respect to the other CARDINAL adversaries , the court found that under LAW they were not the entities liable for restitution of property . The applicants ' respective requests were therefore dismissed . The decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG . They also appealed against the decisions of DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court allowed the applicants ' appeals , set aside the CARDINAL impugned decisions and remitted the case to the Slovenska Bistrica Local Court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG held a hearing and heard submissions from the applicants and their CARDINAL opposing parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court , by an interim decision , upheld the applicants ' claim and decided that Mr PERSON and PERSON ORG were entitled to restitution of all the property taken from them in DATE . The court found that the property in question had not been forfeited already by the nationalisation provisions of the LAW decree of DATE , but only by the later criminal judgment of ORG handed down on CARDINAL DATE . Therefore , the property should be returned to the applicants according to LAW , and not under the provisions of LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the GPE , GPE and the ORG appealed to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants replied and on DATE they requested priority treatment of their case , which was granted .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeals and upheld the decision of the first - instance court . The decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE GPE lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG sodišče ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants replied . On DATE they lodged additional documents and requested the court to decide promptly on the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG set aside the decisions of the second- and first - instance courts in the part concerning GPE and remitted the case to the first - instance court for re - examination . As for the other adversary parties to the proceedings , including GPE , the decision of ORG of DATE became final . The court found that LAW was not necessarily the right basis for the restitution of the property in this case . It instructed the first - instance court to establish clearly whether the property at issue had been confiscated already by the nationalisation provisions of the ORG decree of DATE , or by the criminal judgement of CARDINAL DATE . If the property had already been nationalised by the ORG decree , the property should be returned under the denationalisation provisions of LAW and subject to the limitations for restitution set forth in that LAW . If , on the other hand , the forfeiture of the property had been ordered as a penal sanction following the conviction , the property should be returned under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE GPE lodged preliminary written observations .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants specified before the ORG which plots of land should be returned by GPE further to ORG decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . The proceedings before the Slovenska Bistrica Local Court are still pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted uncontentious proceedings against GPE , GPE ( PERSON ) , ORG and CARDINAL other legal entities in ORG ( ORG sodišče v ORG ) . They requested restitution of the property forfeited by PERSON and PERSON , which was at the time allegedly in the possession of these entities . They also requested an interim measure prohibiting the sale or encumbrance of the property .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE the applicants requested the court to start processing their case and to inform them of the application number of their case .
CARDINAL . At an undetermined time , the judge dealing with the case was replaced .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing which was adjourned sine die to allow the applicants to prepare a reply to the submissions of the adversaries . In addition , the court requested the applicants to supplement their request for an interim measure of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court dismissed the request for an interim measure . The applicants appealed against this decision to ORG ( PERSON sodišče v PERSON ) on DATE . It is not determined what was the final decision of the court regarding the interim measure .
CARDINAL . In DATE , the acting judge was again replaced .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged written submissions with ORG , specifying their claims .
DATE . On DATE the court held a hearing , took submissions from the parties and adjourned the hearing until DATE .
CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE , the court decided to issue a partial decision .
CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE , the applicants requested the court to issue the decision , as announced on DATE . They also lodged a supervisory appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court held another hearing and on DATE it issued a partial decision , stating that Mr PERSON and PERSON were entitled to restitution of all the property taken from them in DATE . The court found that the property in question had been forfeited by the criminal judgment and not by the ORG decree . Hence , the applicants ' claims made under LAW were justified and should be upheld .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE respectively , GPE and GPE appealed against this decision to ORG .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted uncontentious proceedings against GPE , GPE ( PERSON ) the Farmland and Forest Fund and CARDINAL other legal entities in ORG . They requested restitution of the property forfeited by Mr PERSON and PERSON , which was at the time allegedly in the possession of these entities . They also requested that an interim measure be issued prohibiting the sale or encumbrance of the property .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court upheld the applicants ' requests for an interim measure . GPE objected to this decision . The applicants replied to this objection on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE the applicants urged the court to decide on the objection and resume the proceedings on the merits of the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected the objection of GPE . The court also dismissed the applicants ' request that their adversaries transfer possession of the property in question to the applicants for the duration of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE and on DATE the court held hearings . The latter was adjourned due to the objection of CARDINAL parties as to the jurisdiction of the court . It is not certain when the court dismissed this objection .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court delivered a partial decision . It found that under LAW , GPE was liable to return to Mr PERSON certain plots of land and that he should be registered as the owner of these properties in ORG ( PERSON knjiga ) . The court decided to defer issuing a decision concerning the remainder of the claims . The decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , respectively , GPE and the ORG appealed to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the appeals in part , because the first - instance court had wrongly decided which of the parties was liable for the return of the property . In this respect the case was remitted to the first - instance court for re - examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , respectively , GPE and the ORG lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested priority treatment of their case . In a letter of DATE , ORG informed them that cases such as the applicants ' , which concern the restitution of property on the basis of LAW , were regularly dealt with priority .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the appeals on points of law , set aside the decisions of the first- and second - instance courts and remitted the case to ORG for re - examination . The court found that LAW was not necessarily the basis for the restitution of the property in this case . The first - instance court would need to establish clearly whether the property at issue had been confiscated by the ORG decree or by the criminal judgment . The decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court held another hearing .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending .

DATE . On DATE the applicants instituted uncontentious proceedings against GPE , FAC ( PERSON FAC ) ORG and CARDINAL other legal entities in LOC ORG ( ORG sodišče v ORG pri GPE ) . They requested restitution of the property forfeited by Mr PERSON and PERSON , which was at the time allegedly in the possession of these entities .
CARDINAL . The hearings scheduled for DATE and DATE were cancelled .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing and requested the applicants to specify their claim and amend it so as to meet the requirements set by the law .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged preliminary written submissions and increased their claim by seeking damages due to the dilapidation of some real estate .
CARDINAL . A hearing scheduled for DATE was cancelled .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing and adjourned it until DATE in order to acquire the criminal file and documents related to the forfeiture of the property from ORG ( PERSON arhiv PERSON ) . The rescheduled hearing was subsequently cancelled because the requested files had not yet been delivered .
CARDINAL . The hearing scheduled for DATE was cancelled .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing which was adjourned . The applicants were given DATE to submit additional documents .

DATE . On DATE and DATE the court held hearings . The latter hearing was adjourned , since the court had found that there existed a discrepancy between the transcripts from ORG and the facts established by the court . The applicants were ordered to furnish documents identifying all the plots of land claimed within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing and decided to deliver a written decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court delivered a written decision . It decided that it had no jurisdiction to hear the case and set aside all the procedural steps taken . This decision was consistent with its finding that the property in question had not been confiscated by the judgment of ORG but by the ORG decree , and should thus be sought under LAW and before the competent authorities . The court also found that PERSON had not been the ( PERSON of the property claimed . On DATE the decision was served on the applicants .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG ( PERSON v PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants sought priority treatment of their case in ORG .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicants again sought priority treatment of their case in ORG and submitted ORG case - law references in similar cases .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the appeal in part and remitted the case for re - examination . The decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . The remainder of the case was given a new application number .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing and decided to deliver an interim and a partial decision in writing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court found that Mr PERSON and Ms PERSON were entitled to the restitution of property , since it had been forfeited by the criminal judgment of ORG . The court ordered the ORG to return to the applicants several plots of land . The decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG against the decisions concerning the costs and expenses . On DATE , respectively , ORG and the ORG cross - appealed . GPE also cross - appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested ORG for priority treatment of their appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants again sought priority treatment of their case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the president of ORG informed the applicants that their case would be dealt with after the court 's DATE recess .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicants ' appeal in part and allowed the appeals of their adversaries . The decision of the first - instance court was set aside and remitted for re - examination . The court found that the first - instance court had failed to take into consideration the latest case - law of ORG concerning the interpretation of the legal effects of the ORG decree . The decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing and decided to issue a written decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court dismissed all the applicants ' claims . It held that the property at issue had been confiscated by the ORG decree and not by the criminal judgment . Therefore , restitution could not be sought under the provisions of LAW , but rather under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court allowed the appeal , set aside the judgment of the first - instance court and remitted the case for re - examination . The decision was served on the applicants on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court held a hearing . After being asked by the applicants to stay the proceedings due to the out - of - court settlement procedure taking place between the parties , the court adjourned its decision for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing and decided to deliver the final decision in writing .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending .

On DATE , ORG for ORG ( ORG ) adopted the Decree on ORG , on ORG and on ORG which ORG Odlok o prehodu sovražnikovega imetja v državno svojino , o državnem upravljanju imetja odsotnih oseb in o zasegi imetja , ki so ga okupatorske oblasti prisilno odtujile , “ the ORG decree ” ) , which entered into force on DATE . Its section CARDINAL provided for nationalisation of the following categories of property :
a ) all the property of ORG and its citizens which is on the territory of GPE ;

b ) all the property of people of NORP origin , except those who were fighting for the national liberation movement and its partisan forces , or are the citizens of neutral countries and did not act for the enemy side ;

c ) all the property of war criminals and their supporters , irrespective of their nationality , as well as all the property of every person who was convicted by an ordinary or a military court and sentenced to forfeiture of his or her property to the ORG .

LAW ( Zakon o denacionalizaciji , ORG no . CARDINAL ) formed the basis for restitution of property ( or its value ) that had passed into ORG ownership through previous legislation ( agrarian reform , nationalisation , confiscation , etc . ) .

Section CARDINAL provides that all natural persons whose property had passed into ORG ownership on the basis of the listed legislation adopted in the aftermath of the Second World War , including the LAW decree , LAW and LAW against the Nation and the ORG , are entitled to denationalisation . LAW further specifies that all other natural persons whose property was nationalised by a legal act issued before DATE are entitled to denationalisation .

In section CARDINAL , LAW originally extended its provisions also to property forfeited by virtue of criminal judgments handed down before DATE . This provision was rescinded by ORG on DATE , partly on the ground that it was retroactive and therefore violated LAW ( decision no . ORG ) . According to these findings , the restitution of property which was forfeited by virtue of criminal judgments handed down before DATE should instead be governed by LAW .

On DATE , the Act on Temporary , Partial Suspension of Restitution of Property ( Official Journal no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) entered into force , which held in abeyance certain types of restitution proceedings for a period of DATE .

Prior to DATE amendments , LAW ( Zakon o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij , ORG no . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) applied also to the restitution of property forfeited in criminal proceedings which had terminated before DATE and the decision of which had later been quashed .
The DATE LAW of , and Supplements to , LAW ( Zakon o spremembah in dopolnitvah PERSON o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij , ORG no . CARDINAL ) made minor amendments to LAW .

It also added new ORG and CARDINALC to LAW . As far as the criminal proceedings terminated before DATE are concerned , ORG replaced LAW and referred to the provisions of LAW to govern the form and scope of restitution , the restrictions on restitution and the valuation of property in case of claims for restitution of property forfeited in criminal proceedings terminated DATE . Section CARDINALC expressly removed the right to compensation for the previous owner 's inability to make use of the property during the period of forfeiture .

Section CARDINAL made the change applicable in non - contentious and contentious proceedings concerning the restitution of confiscated property when such proceedings had commenced before the LAW came into force but had not become final by that time .

In DATE , further to ORG ruling of DATE , Section CARDINAL was amended again so that persons entitled under ORG might claim compensation for being unable to use or to manage the property or for loss of earnings incurred throughout the period running from the quashing of the forfeiture of the property until the decision on its restitution becomes final .

On DATE the Act on the Temporary Suspension of Certain Provisions of the Denationalisation Act and of LAW ( Zakon o začasnem zadržanju izvajanja nekaterih določb zakona o denacionalizaciji in zakona o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij , ORG no . CARDINAL ) was adopted . Its LAW suspended , originally until DATE and subsequently , under new legislation , until DATE , proceedings concerning claims for the restitution of or compensation for property which had been confiscated by virtue of criminal judgments handed down before DATE , or which was of a “ feudal origin ” .
The following provisions of LAW ( PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL ) are particularly relevant for the present case :
“ Everyone has the right to have any decision regarding his rights , duties and any charges brought against him made without undue delay by an independent , impartial court constituted by law .

“ Everyone shall have the right to compensation for damage caused by the unlawful acts of a person or body when performing a function or engaged in an activity on behalf of a state or local authority or as a holder of public office ... ”

On DATE ORG decided in favour of the applicants and some other individuals , who had lodged a constitutional appeal challenging the provisions of the LAW on the Temporary Suspension of Certain Provisions of LAW and of LAW . It ruled ( a joined decision U - I-CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , that the legislator did not have a justified cause to differentiate between the claims for restitution of property of a feudal and non - feudal origin .

Following another constitutional appeal lodged by Mr PERSON and some other individuals , ORG ruled on DATE , ( a joined decision no . U - I-CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , that the challenged provisions of section GPE and CARDINAL of the DATE LAW of , and Supplements to , LAW did not conflict with the LAW because such interference with the constitutional rights granted in LAW ( right to rehabilitation and compensation in criminal proceedings ) and CARDINAL ( right to own and inherit property ) of the LAW was indispensable for the protection of the rights of other claimants under LAW .

ORG further ruled that LAW on Amendments of , and Supplements to , LAW was in conformity with the LAW notwithstanding the fact that it retroactively interfered with acquired rights , because the retroactive effect of the LAW was justified by the public interest .

The LAW on the Protection of the Right to a Trial without undue Delay ( Zakon o varstvu pravice do sojenja brez nepotrebnega odlašanja , ORG , No . DATE ) has been implemented since DATE . Under its sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL , the right to a trial within a reasonable time is guaranteed for a party to court proceedings , a participant under the LAW governing non - contentious proceedings and an injured party in criminal proceedings .

Section CARDINAL provides for CARDINAL remedies to expedite pending proceedings - a supervisory appeal ( nadzorstvena pritožba ) and a motion for a deadline ( rokovni predlog ) - and , ultimately , for a claim for just satisfaction in respect of damage sustained because of the undue delay ( zahteva za pravično zadoščenje ) .
